channel.title: RuneSource/Azure - Emotes Handler

item.title: RuneSource/Azure - Emotes Handler
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:32, topic:539314”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=658149.msg4405134#msg4405134 date=1391715102]

I never said there is nothing wrong with it, I was just stating that what he was doing is bad practice. Regardless if it “isn’t too big” your design should always be a concern.

[/quote]Which part of it is bad practice? At first glance I don’t see anything in the link you gave that related to what he was doing

pretty sure he’s referring to

for (Emote emote : Emote.values()) { if(emote.getButtonId() == buttonId) { player.animation(emote.ANIMATION); return false; } else if(buttonId == 74108) { for (AccomplishmentEmote accomplishment : AccomplishmentEmote.values()) { if(accomplishment.hasItem(player)) { player.animation(accomplishment.ANIMATION); player.gfx(accomplishment.GRAPHIC); break; } else player.getServerPacketBuilder().sendMessage("You must be wearing a skillcape to perform this emote."); } } }

looping through the enum each time an animation is played when he could have just used a hashmap to store the data[/quote]This is not a place you’d want to use a map either, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneSource/Azure - Emotes Handler
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:31, topic:539314”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=658149.msg4402371#msg4402371 date=1390946891]
I never said there is nothing wrong with it, I was just stating that what he was doing is bad practice. Regardless if it “isn’t too big” your design should always be a concern.

[/quote]Which part of it is bad practice? At first glance I don’t see anything in the link you gave that related to what he was doing[/quote]
pretty sure he’s referring to

for (Emote emote : Emote.values()) { if(emote.getButtonId() == buttonId) { player.animation(emote.ANIMATION); return false; } else if(buttonId == 74108) { for (AccomplishmentEmote accomplishment : AccomplishmentEmote.values()) { if(accomplishment.hasItem(player)) { player.animation(accomplishment.ANIMATION); player.gfx(accomplishment.GRAPHIC); break; } else player.getServerPacketBuilder().sendMessage("You must be wearing a skillcape to perform this emote."); } } }

looping through the enum each time an animation is played when he could have just used a hashmap to store the data

Read full topic

item.title: RuneSource/Azure - Emotes Handler
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

how can the script manager be needed, when honestly this is just a map of some keys to values.

doesn’t matter how you write it.

i could write a “script manager” to load this data from a .txt file, and parse it via button:emote whereas the colon splits data.

so my “script” can look like so
168:885
169:856
164:858
167:859

and you wouldn’t know what it was.

etc, etc.

posting the script. not like anyone is gonna steal your shit because it’s emotes and can/has been done a million times before, in multiple methods.

stop acting like you’re so great and either post it, or don’t try bragging about how your “python system” is “better than this”

Read full topic

item.title: RuneSource/Azure - Emotes Handler
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:26, topic:539314”][quote author=artem543 link=topic=658149.msg4404856#msg4404856 date=1391619069]
It’s based on Hyperion. I wrote my own script manager that I won’t release
[/quote]
I honestly doubt this lol[/quote]

Your decision to believe or not.

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:25, topic:539314”][quote author=artem543 link=topic=658149.msg4404884#msg4404884 date=1391627537]

It’s based on Hyperion. I wrote my own script manager that I won’t release

He means release the python version of this, nimwit.

Scripts are common sense to write. The script handler I what would be needed but I do not want to share it.
[/quote]

please stop.[/quote]

Stop what? I don’t want to release it…

Read full topic

[/quote]

I do prefer java. Mind linking me to a good scripting tutorial? I suck at scripting.[/quote]He posted his ruby script manager a while back, I couldn’t find it though. You just need to pick a JVM language and write a loader for it.

item.title: RuneSource/Azure - Emotes Handler
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:6, topic:539314”] private Animation ANIMATION; private Gfx GRAPHIC;

those are not constants, why caps?

for (Emote emote : Emote.values()) {
                          if(emote.getButtonId() == buttonId) {

stuff like this is bad practice…

read about enums and how they should be used here.[/quote]Not really a concern since the enum isn’t too big. You could do that if you want though, nothing wrong with it i suppose.

Read full topic
